subject: Programming
title: Code Review Culture
description: A micro-lesson that makes Code Review Culture usable.

hook.text: A second pair of eyes catches bugs, shares knowledge, and raises the quality bar for everyone.

buildup.text: Modern code review happens through pull requests â€” proposed changes that must be approved before merging.

discovery.text: Studies show code reviews catch 60% of defects before they reach testing or production.

twist.text: Toxic reviews destroy morale. The best reviewers ask questions and explain alternatives, never mock.

climax.text: Code review is the fastest way to level up a team. Knowledge spreads one pull request at a time.

punchline.text: Two eyes are always better than one.

quiz.question: What percentage of defects can code reviews catch?
